subtasks: Research the correct classification of peanuts
Choose appropriate peanut variety for climate
Prepare planting area by amending soil
Properly sow peanut seeds, ensuring correct depth and spacing
Transplant seedlings if necessary, with careful handling
Apply mulch to maintain soil conditions
Provide adequate watering and avoid excessive moisture
Avoid fertilizers that may hinder fruit development
Hill soil around peanut plants when they reach a certain height
Monitor for unpollinated flowers and ensure proper peanut formation
Apply light mulch to prevent soil crust formation
Manage water consistently, avoiding excessive irrigation
Check maturity signs such as yellow leaves and visible gold-marked veins on nuts
Timing of harvest to prevent premature or delayed digging
Correctly dig or pull plants while keeping roots intact
Remove excess soil from plants
Allow proper drying of plants after harvest
Process harvested peanuts by removing shells
Store unshelled peanuts in airtight containers for long-term保存
